definitions.definition: To make a mark or attach a tag to the ear of (an animal , chiefly a livestock animal), generally to identify or indicate something about the animal, such as ownership .

subdefinitions.definition: To put a distinguishing or identifying mark or sign on (something); to make (something) distinctive or identifiable .
To designate or set aside (someone or something) for a particular purpose ; to allocate .

Chiefly followed by for : to designate (certain funds ) to be used for a specific purpose. ( UK ) To designate ( part of a pension ) to be payable to the holder 's former spouse or payment when the pension is paid . ( US , politics ) Of the Congress : to designate that certain federal funds be appropriated for a specific project .
examples: You can donate to the organization as a whole, or you can earmark your contribution for a particular project.

main_definition: ( chiefly agriculture ) To make a mark or attach a tag to the ear of (an animal , chiefly a livestock animal), generally to identify or indicate something about the animal, such as ownership .
